meanings.definition: To shout or call loudly to someone
meanings.sent1: He holloaed to his friend across the field.
meanings.sent2: The coach holloaed instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The little boy holloaed for his mom when he got lost in the store.
meanings.sent4: The protesters holloaed their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent5: She holloaed for help when she saw the car crash.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, echoing cry or noise
meanings.sent1: The owl holloaed in the night, startling the campers.
meanings.sent2: The wind holloaed through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent3: The old house holloaed with the sound of creaking floorboards.
meanings.sent4: The thunder holloaed in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The wolf holloaed at the moon, creating an eerie atmosphere in the forest.
